content.text: Community members engaged in discussions about token economics and platform utility. User soso questioned how token price would increase through the open source platform, emphasizing the need for clear use cases beyond the platform itself. The conversation touched on concerns about DAO projects, with humorous suggestions like 'DaosdotScam' and 'RugsRus' being thrown around. A significant announcement was shared about new Earnings and Redemptions features on the platform, allowing users to convert earnings to elizaOS tokens. The community expressed excitement about upcoming developments, with one member stating '2026 is going to melt faces'.

Profile picture changes sparked discussion among community members. User Kenk changed their profile picture, prompting reactions from the community. Biazs expressed preference for the previous monkey profile picture. Kenk considered reverting the change, calling it a 'big decision'. User untitledxyz encouraged keeping the new DeCC0 look. An interesting demonstration of ElizaOS capabilities was shared where an NFT named 'Lyham' was asked about being used as a profile picture, generating a poetic response about digital identity and belonging. This showcased the unique feature of being able to interact with NFTs through ElizaOS.

Technical support discussions occurred in the coders channel regarding TEXT_LARGE errors. User Thirtieth reported encountering TEXT_LARGE errors even when sending simple messages like 'hi'. The error indicated no handler was found for delegate type TEXT_LARGE. Moderator sayonara diagnosed the issue as OpenAI or other AI plugins not being registered properly. The user then faced plugin installation failures with the OpenAI plugin. Sayonara suggested running package updates and trying the elizaos update command to resolve the issues.

Shaw provided updates on ElizaOS Cloud development, describing it as 'looking real good'. The platform is focused on quickly building not just agents, but also apps, n8n workflows, and MCP/A2A services. A complete loop has been implemented: create, publish, monetize, and promote. New integrations include SEO, advertising network, and social publishing capabilities. Shaw mentioned that getting X (Twitter) integration back is looking very likely. Community member DannyNOR noted the need to gain momentum, suggesting that X integration and cloud launch could provide significant help.

Visual content was shared in the partners channel showcasing 'Business Eliza' with multiple professional-looking images. Core developer jin shared educational content, mentioning watching many videos from a particular channel lately, which received positive reactions from the team.

A user inquired about migrating AI16z tokens to ElizaOS using a Ledger hardware wallet. DorianD confirmed it was possible and explained the process of connecting hardware wallets to various Chrome Solana wallets like Talisman, Rabby, Solflare, or Phantom, then connecting to the migration site. The user initially had trouble seeing their AI16z holdings when connecting their Ledger. Multiple scam alerts were issued during these discussions, warning community members about fraudulent messages.

A beta product called myguo was shared in the community, described as AI-native portfolio intelligence for onchain users. The product demonstration video showed portfolio management capabilities. Community members also discussed a video about building effective AI coding agents, focusing on hard-won lessons and practical implementation rather than theoretical approaches.

categories.title: ElizaOS Project Activity Summary for December 13, 2025

content.text: No significant activity was reported across the ElizaOS project on December 13, 2025. There were no new features implemented, no bug fixes applied, and no documentation enhancements made. Additionally, no new pull requests or issues were opened or closed during this period.
